title: Englishpod 初级 英文播客 0311

segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 大家好，欢迎来到EnglishPod。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: My name is Catherine.
segments.cn: 我叫Catherine。

segments.en: And today we're talking about a very important topic.
segments.cn: 今天我们要讨论一个非常重要的话题。

segments.en: This is about time.
segments.cn: 这是关于时间的。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So sometimes we are a little bit lazy or maybe we sleep too much and we're late to work or a meeting.
segments.cn: 有时候我们有点懒惰，或者可能睡得太多，导致上班或开会迟到。

segments.en: All right, so learn many different ways to talk about being late today.
segments.cn: 好吧，今天我们学习多种谈论迟到的方式。

segments.en: Let's take a listen to our dialogue.
segments.cn: 让我们来听听我们的对话。

segments.en: Okay, everyone, shall we begin?
segments.cn: 好的，大家，我们开始吧？

segments.en: Sorry, Maggie, but we're missing a few people.
segments.cn: 对不起，Maggie，但我们还缺几个人。

segments.en: Can we hang on a sec?
segments.cn: 我们能等一下吗？

segments.en: Well, I did say 11 o'clock sharp and it's now five past, so... Hi, everyone.
segments.cn: 嗯，我确实说过11点整，现在已经过了五分钟，所以……大家好。

segments.en: I'm so sorry I'm late.
segments.cn: 我很抱歉我迟到了。

segments.en: It's raining cats and dogs outside and I had to wait ages for a taxi.
segments.cn: 外面下着倾盆大雨，我等了很久才叫到出租车。

segments.en: Okay, James, take a seat quickly, please.
segments.cn: 好的，James，请快点坐下。

segments.en: Right, the subject of the meeting is the importance.
segments.cn: 好的，会议的主题是重要性。

segments.en: Hi, guys.
segments.cn: 嗨，大家。

segments.en: Please excuse me.
segments.cn: 请原谅我。

segments.en: I was held up in traffic.
segments.cn: 我在交通中耽搁了。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: As I was saying, the subject of the meeting is... Hi, Maggie, I'm terribly sorry.
segments.cn: 正如我所说，会议的主题是……嗨，Maggie，我非常抱歉。

segments.en: The traffic is murder out there.
segments.cn: 外面的交通真是太糟糕了。

segments.en: Sit down, Bruno.
segments.cn: 坐下，Bruno。

segments.en: Okay, now, as you're aware, the topic for the meeting is the importance of being punctual.
segments.cn: 好的，现在，正如你所知道的，会议的主题是守时的重要性。

segments.en: Who would like to start?
segments.cn: 谁想开始？

segments.en: All right, we're back.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们回来了。

segments.en: So now let's take a look at some of this vocab on language takeaway.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看一些语言要点。

segments.en: Language takeaway.
segments.cn: 语言要点。

segments.en: So first up, we have a word that we heard.
segments.cn: 首先，我们有一个我们听到的词。

segments.en: The phrase was, I did say 11 o'clock sharp.
segments.cn: 这个短语是，我确实说过11点整。

segments.en: Okay, so if you say the time, like 11 o'clock, and then you add sharp at the end, what does that mean?
segments.cn: 好的，如果你说时间，比如11点，然后在后面加上整，这是什么意思？

segments.en: That means exactly.
segments.cn: 这意味着准确。

segments.en: So 11 o'clock, exactly 11 o'clock.
segments.cn: 所以11点，准确是11点。

segments.en: Not 11-0-1, not 11-0-2, but 11 o'clock.
So if I say, I'll be there at 3 o'clock sharp.
segments.cn: 所以如果我说，我会在3点整到达。

segments.en: That means you won't be there at 2.58.
segments.cn: 这意味着你不会在2点58到达。

segments.en: You will not be there at 3.04.
segments.cn: 你不会在3点04到达。

segments.en: You'll be there at 3 o'clock.
segments.cn: 你会在3点到达。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Okay, so 3 o'clock sharp.
segments.cn: 好的，所以3点整。

segments.en: So if you say the time and then you add sharp, it means at that exact time.
segments.cn: 所以如果你说时间，然后加上整，这意味着在那个确切的时间。

segments.en: Now, James was late.
segments.cn: 现在，James迟到了。

segments.en: He said he was late because he had to wait ages for a taxi.
segments.cn: 他说他迟到是因为他等了很久才叫到出租车。

segments.en: Okay, so this might be confusing for some people, Marco, because I can say, what's your age?
segments.cn: 好的，这可能会让一些人困惑，Marco，因为我可以说，你多大了？

segments.en: How old are you?
segments.cn: 你几岁？

segments.en: But here, ages has a different meaning.
segments.cn: 但在这里，ages有不同的意思。

segments.en: So I had to wait ages means I waited a very long time.
segments.cn: 所以我等了很久意味着我等了很长时间。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So the word ages means for a very long time.
segments.cn: 所以ages这个词意味着很长时间。

segments.en: It's always related to time in this sense.
segments.cn: 在这个意义上总是与时间相关。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So I could say, Marco, it's so good to see you.
segments.cn: 所以我可以说，Marco，见到你真好。

segments.en: I haven't seen you in ages.
segments.cn: 我已经很久没见到你了。

segments.en: That means I haven't seen you in such a long time.
segments.cn: 这意味着我很久没见到你了。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: And now the next person, Sally, came in and she said she was held up in traffic.
segments.cn: 现在下一个人，Sally，进来了，她说她在交通中耽搁了。

segments.en: Okay, to be held up in traffic means to be stuck in traffic.
segments.cn: 好的，被交通耽搁意味着被困在交通中。

segments.en: That means you were made late because there were so many cars on the road.
segments.cn: 这意味着你因为路上有太多车而迟到了。

segments.en: Okay, so somebody or something else made you late.
segments.cn: 好的，所以是某人或某事让你迟到了。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So to be held up means to be made late.
segments.cn: 所以被耽搁意味着被迫迟到。

segments.en: I could held you up.
segments.cn: 我可以耽搁你。

segments.en: Exactly, what held you up.
segments.cn: 正是如此，是什么让你迟到。

segments.en: That means what made me late.
segments.cn: 这意味着是什么让我迟到。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: It could be many different things.
segments.cn: 这可能有很多不同的原因。

segments.en: Okay, yeah.
segments.cn: 好的，是的。

segments.en: Okay, yeah, so it could be traffic or maybe I could be held up by the doctor.
segments.cn: 好的，是的，所以可能是交通，或者我可能被医生耽搁了。

segments.en: Maybe he took longer than what I expected.
segments.cn: 也许他花的时间比我预期的要长。

segments.en: Or there's no elevator and I'm waiting for the elevator and I got held up by the elevator.
segments.cn: 或者没有电梯，我在等电梯，我被电梯耽搁了。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: And now the importance of being punctual, that's the topic of the meeting.
segments.cn: 现在守时的重要性，这是会议的主题。

segments.en: And so what is this word punctual?
segments.cn: 那么这个词守时是什么意思？

segments.en: Okay, so punctual is an adjective and it describes something as being on time.
segments.cn: 好的，守时是一个形容词，描述某事准时。

segments.en: Okay, so the opposite of this word would be what?
segments.cn: 好的，这个词的反义词是什么？

segments.en: So the opposite would be late.
segments.cn: 所以反义词是迟到。

segments.en: Late.
segments.cn: 迟到。

segments.en: Okay, so she's a very punctual student.
segments.cn: 好的，所以她是一个非常守时的学生。

segments.en: She always comes to class on time.
segments.cn: 她总是准时上课。

segments.en: She's never late.
segments.cn: 她从不迟到。

segments.en: Punctual.
segments.cn: 守时。

segments.en: So you describe a person as being punctual or not.
segments.cn: 所以你可以描述一个人是守时的或不守时的。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: Let's review all this vocab.
segments.cn: 让我们复习一下所有这些词汇。

segments.en: Let's go back and listen to the dialogue again.
segments.cn: 让我们回去再听一遍对话。

segments.en: Okay everyone, shall we begin?
segments.cn: 好的，大家，我们开始吧？

segments.en: Sorry Maggie, but we're missing a few people.
segments.cn: 对不起，Maggie，但我们还缺几个人。

segments.en: Can we hang on a sec?
segments.cn: 我们能等一下吗？

segments.en: Well, I did say 11 o'clock sharp and it's now five past, so...
segments.cn: 嗯，我确实说过11点整，现在已经过了五分钟，所以……

segments.en: Hi everyone, I'm so sorry I'm late.
segments.cn: 大家好，我很抱歉我迟到了。

segments.en: It's raining cats and dogs outside and I had to wait ages for a taxi.
segments.cn: 外面下着倾盆大雨，我等了很久才叫到出租车。

segments.en: Okay James, take a seat quickly please.
segments.cn: 好的，James，请快点坐下。

segments.en: Right, the subject of the meeting is the importance.
segments.cn: 好的，会议的主题是重要性。

segments.en: Hi guys, please excuse me.
segments.cn: 嗨，大家，请原谅我。

segments.en: I was held up in traffic.
segments.cn: 我在交通中耽搁了。

segments.en: Right, as I was saying the subject of the meeting is...
segments.cn: 对，正如我所说，会议的主题是……

segments.en: Hi Maggie, I'm terribly sorry.
segments.cn: 嗨，Maggie，我非常抱歉。

segments.en: The traffic is murder out there.
segments.cn: 外面的交通真是太糟糕了。

segments.en: Sit down, bro.
segments.cn: 坐下，兄弟。

segments.en: No?
segments.cn: 不？

segments.en: Okay now, as you're aware, the topic for the meeting is the importance of being punctual.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在，正如你所知道的，会议的主题是准时的重要性。

segments.en: Who would like to start?
segments.cn: 谁想开始？

segments.en: All right, now let's take a look at some phrases on Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在让我们看看流利表达的几个短语。

segments.en: Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 流利表达。

segments.en: We have a lot of really great phrases today that describe, well, that are excuses for not being on time or for not being punctual.
segments.cn: 今天我们有很多很好的短语，描述，嗯，作为迟到或不准时的借口。

segments.en: The first one we heard was actually different though.
segments.cn: 我们听到的第一个其实是不同的。

segments.en: One of the students said, can we hang on a sec?
segments.cn: 一位学生说，我们可以等一下吗？

segments.en: Hang on a sec.
segments.cn: 等一下。

segments.en: Okay, so if you ask someone to hang on, that means to wait.
segments.cn: 好的，所以如果你让某人等一下，那就是让他们等。

segments.en: Hang on, wait.
segments.cn: 等一下，等。

segments.en: Yeah, exactly.
segments.cn: 是的，正是如此。

segments.en: So hang on just means to wait.
segments.cn: 所以等一下只是意味着等待。

segments.en: It's very casual.
segments.cn: 这很随意。

segments.en: Okay, now if we add a sec, hang on a sec, or hang on a minute, that means wait for a little while.
segments.cn: 好的，现在如果我们加上“一下”，等一下，或等一分钟，那就是等一小会儿。

segments.en: A little while.
segments.cn: 一小会儿。

segments.en: A sec, S-E-C, stands for second.
segments.cn: “一下”，S-E-C，代表秒。

segments.en: And it's very common in this phrase.
segments.cn: 在这个短语中非常常见。

segments.en: We hear hang on a sec, or wait a sec.
segments.cn: 我们听到“等一下”或“等一秒”。

segments.en: Wait a sec, uh-huh.
segments.cn: 等一下，嗯哼。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: So it's very casual, it's very spoken English, although the word sec doesn't really exist.
segments.cn: 所以这很随意，是口语英语，尽管“秒”这个词并不存在。

segments.en: It's just a short way of saying second.
segments.cn: 这只是说“秒”的一种简短方式。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: And later on, we heard James come in.
segments.cn: 后来，我们听到詹姆斯进来了。

segments.en: He was one of those people that we had to wait for.
segments.cn: 他是我们必须等的人之一。

segments.en: And he said, it's raining cats and dogs outside.
segments.cn: 他说，外面下着倾盆大雨。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Okay, it's raining cats and dogs.
segments.cn: 好的，外面下着倾盆大雨。

segments.en: So are cats and dogs falling from the sky?
segments.cn: 所以猫和狗是从天上掉下来的吗？

segments.en: They are not.
segments.cn: 不是。

segments.en: So this might sound very weird to you.
segments.cn: 所以这可能听起来很奇怪。

segments.en: This does not mean there are cats and dogs falling down from the clouds.
segments.cn: 这并不意味着有猫和狗从云层中掉下来。

segments.en: But it does mean that it's raining a lot.
segments.cn: 但这确实意味着下着很多雨。

segments.en: It's raining really hard outside.
segments.cn: 外面下着很大的雨。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: So it's a phrase used to say it's raining a lot.
segments.cn: 所以这是一个用来表示下着很多雨的短语。

segments.en: It's raining very, very hard.
segments.cn: 下着非常非常大的雨。

segments.en: Raining cats and dogs.
segments.cn: 倾盆大雨。

segments.en: So Maggie is trying to continue with the meeting as many people keep coming in and disrupting her.
segments.cn: 所以玛吉试图继续会议，因为很多人不断进来打扰她。

segments.en: So she says, right.
segments.cn: 所以她说，对。

segments.en: As I was saying, the subject of the meeting.
segments.cn: 正如我所说，会议的主题。

segments.en: As I was saying.
segments.cn: 正如我所说。

segments.en: Now this is a really important phrase because you're going to hear this a lot in meetings or in conversations where someone is distracted.
segments.cn: 现在这是一个非常重要的短语，因为你会在会议或对话中听到很多次，当有人分心时。

segments.en: So, okay, we're having, oh wait, I'm sorry, I have to talk to this person over here.
segments.cn: 所以，好吧，我们正在进行，哦，等一下，我很抱歉，我得和那边的人谈谈。

segments.en: When you want to come back to what you were talking about, you want to return to the topic, you say, as I was saying.
segments.cn: 当你想回到你正在谈论的内容时，你想回到主题，你会说，正如我所说。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: As I was saying.
segments.cn: 正如我所说。

segments.en: So maybe you were interrupted, maybe you got distracted and you want to continue talking about the same topic, as I was saying.
segments.cn: 所以也许你被打断了，也许你分心了，你想继续谈论同一个主题，正如我所说。

segments.en: And then you continue talking.
segments.cn: 然后你继续说。

segments.en: So you return to the original point you are making.
segments.cn: 所以你回到你所说的原始观点。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: And well, Bruno was the last guy to come in and he said that traffic is murder out there.
segments.cn: 而且，布鲁诺是最后一个进来的人，他说外面的交通真是太糟糕了。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So murder to murder means to kill someone.
segments.cn: 所以“谋杀”意味着杀死某人。

segments.en: But we're not talking about killing people here.
segments.cn: 但我们这里并不是在谈论杀人。

segments.en: We're talking about an analogy or saying it's as bad as murder.
segments.cn: 我们在谈论一个比喻，或者说这糟糕得像谋杀一样。

segments.en: So in this case, traffic is murder means traffic is really awful.
segments.cn: 所以在这种情况下，交通是谋杀意味着交通真的很糟糕。

segments.en: It's really terrible outside.
segments.cn: 外面真的很糟糕。

segments.en: So in what other situation or with what other noun instead of traffic can we use this something is murder?
segments.cn: 那么在什么其他情况下，或者用什么其他名词代替交通，我们可以用“某事是谋杀”呢？

segments.en: The weight is murder.
segments.cn: 体重是谋杀。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So that means you have to wait a very, very long time.
segments.cn: 所以这意味着你必须等很长很长时间。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: So now why don't we go back to the dialogue?
segments.cn: 所以现在我们为什么不回到对话中？

segments.en: Let's have one last review and we'll be right back.
segments.cn: 让我们最后复习一次，然后我们马上回来。

segments.en: Okay, everyone, shall we begin?
segments.cn: 好的，大家，我们开始吧？

segments.en: Sorry, Maggie, but we're missing a few people.
segments.cn: 对不起，玛吉，但我们还缺几个人。

segments.en: Can we hang on a sec?
segments.cn: 我们可以等一下吗？

segments.en: Well, I did say 11 o'clock sharp and it's now five past.
segments.cn: 嗯，我确实说过11点整，现在已经过了五分钟。

segments.en: So... Hi, everyone.
segments.cn: 所以...嗨，大家。

segments.en: I'm so sorry I'm late.
segments.cn: 我很抱歉我迟到了。

segments.en: It's raining cats and dogs outside and I had to wait ages for a taxi.
segments.cn: 外面下着倾盆大雨，我等了很久才叫到出租车。

segments.en: Okay, James, take a seat quickly, please.
segments.cn: 好的，詹姆斯，请快坐下。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: The subject of the meeting is the importance.
segments.cn: 会议的主题是重要性。

segments.en: Hi, guys.
segments.cn: 嗨，大家。

segments.en: Please excuse me.
segments.cn: 请原谅我。

segments.en: I was held up in traffic.
segments.cn: 我在交通中耽搁了。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: As I was saying, the subject of the meeting is... Hi, Maggie.
segments.cn: 正如我所说，会议的主题是...嗨，玛吉。

segments.en: I'm terribly sorry.
segments.cn: 我非常抱歉。

segments.en: The traffic is murder out there.
segments.cn: 外面的交通真是太糟糕了。

segments.en: Sit down, Bruno.
segments.cn: 坐下，布鲁诺。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: Now, as you're aware, the topic for the meeting is the importance of being punctual.
segments.cn: 现在，正如你所知道的，会议的主题是准时的重要性。

segments.en: Who would like to start?
segments.cn: 谁想开始？

segments.en: So, Marco, are you a punctual person or are you usually late?
segments.cn: 所以，马尔科，你是一个守时的人，还是通常迟到？

segments.en: For social gatherings, I'm usually pretty punctual.
segments.cn: 对于社交聚会，我通常很守时。

segments.en: For work, I'm usually very late.
segments.cn: 对于工作，我通常很晚。

segments.en: I've noticed.
segments.cn: 我注意到了。

segments.en: You're one of the last people to come in in the morning.
segments.cn: 你是早上最后到的人之一。

segments.en: Yeah, usually for work, I arrive late, but not like too late.
segments.cn: 是的，通常工作时我会迟到，但不会太晚。

segments.en: Some people may even be an hour or two or something.
segments.cn: 有些人可能会迟到一两个小时。

segments.en: A couple minutes, 15 minutes is all right.
segments.cn: 几分钟，15分钟还可以。

segments.en: But I do hate to wait if we agree to meet up at two o'clock and you come in at 2.30, I don't know, let's say to the movies, then I think that's really irritating.
segments.cn: 但如果我们约好两点见面，你却在2:30到，我就觉得很烦人，比如去看电影。

segments.en: I agree.
segments.cn: 我同意。

segments.en: I'm a very punctual person and I get very annoyed when people are late to meetings or when people come late to appointments or parties.
segments.cn: 我是一个非常准时的人，当人们迟到开会或约会、聚会时我会非常恼火。

segments.en: Yeah, and I think it's different in different countries because, you know, in many different places, they have what they call the local time.
segments.cn: 是的，我认为在不同国家是不同的，因为你知道，在许多地方，他们有所谓的当地时间。

segments.en: So if you say, okay, the meeting is at nine, then everyone assumes that the meeting is supposed to start at nine, but then everyone comes in at nine, but grabs a cup of coffee, talks at the cooler, gets their seat, checks their email, and then the meeting will start at 9.30 instead of nine.
segments.cn: 所以如果你说，好的，会议在九点，那么每个人都认为会议应该在九点开始，但每个人九点到，却先去喝咖啡、聊天、找座位、查看邮件，然后会议会在9:30开始，而不是九点。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: Or for example, the transportation you will find in different countries can be punctual or not punctual.
segments.cn: 或者例如，不同国家的交通可以准时或不准时。

segments.en: In Germany, their transportation is very famous for being punctual.
segments.cn: 在德国，他们的交通以准时著称。

segments.en: But in India, you will find that the trains are not very punctual, you might wait one or two or six hours for a train.
segments.cn: 但在印度，你会发现火车不太准时，可能要等一两个小时或六个小时才能等到火车。

segments.en: Yeah, exactly.
segments.cn: 是的，没错。

segments.en: So it's different in different countries.
segments.cn: 所以在不同国家是不同的。

segments.en: I imagine that in a place like Germany, it would be considered a very bad thing to arrive late to a meeting, for example.
segments.cn: 我想在像德国这样的地方，迟到开会会被认为是非常糟糕的事情。

segments.en: Yeah, I'm curious about that.
segments.cn: 是的，我对此很好奇。

segments.en: So let us know, is it acceptable in your country to be a little bit late to a meeting or to an appointment?
segments.cn: 所以告诉我们，在你的国家，迟到一点点开会或约会是可以接受的吗？

segments.en: Is punctuality important?
segments.cn: 准时重要吗？

segments.en: Let us know.
segments.cn: 告诉我们。

segments.en: Our website is EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 我们的网站是 EnglishPod.com。

segments.en: All right, we'll see you guys there.
segments.cn: 好的，我们在那里见。

segments.en: Bye.
segments.cn: 再见。
